==Wisdom and philosophy==
 
==Wisdom and philosophy==
 
A standard [[philosophy|philosophical]] definition says that wisdom consists of making the best use of available [[propositional knowledge|knowledge]]. As with all decisions, a wise decision may be made with incomplete [[information]]. The technical philosophical term for the opposite of wisdom is [[folly]].
 
A standard [[philosophy|philosophical]] definition says that wisdom consists of making the best use of available [[propositional knowledge|knowledge]]. As with all decisions, a wise decision may be made with incomplete [[information]]. The technical philosophical term for the opposite of wisdom is [[folly]].
  +
In his ''Metaphysics'', Aristotle defines wisdom as knowledge of causes: ''why'' things are the way they are.
